com.terremark.config
Interface RetryHandler

public interface RetryHandler

Interface that can be implemented to specify custom retry strategy. It is possible that API calls can fail randomly. When a HTTP GET call fails with error code greater than 499, the call can be retried. User's can determine if a specific failed call needs to be retried and how many times. Other types of HTTP request (such as POST, PUT, DELETE) cannot be retried. Implementation of this interface will only be invoked for HTTP GET calls that fail with 500 or greater error code.

Author:
Seshu Pasam
See Also:
PropertiesBuilder.setRetryHandler(RetryHandler)

Method Summary
<T> boolean
shouldRetry(int failuresSoFar, TerremarkException exception, String relativePath, Map<String,String> queryParams, Map<String,String> extraHeaders, Class<T> responseClass, Object... arguments)
          Method invoked to determine if the API call should be retried or not.
 

Method Detail

shouldRetry

<T> boolean shouldRetry(int failuresSoFar,
                        TerremarkException exception,
                        String relativePath,
                        Map<String,String> queryParams,
                        Map<String,String> extraHeaders,
                        Class<T> responseClass,
                        Object... arguments)
Method invoked to determine if the API call should be retried or not.

Parameters:
failuresSoFar - Number of failures so far. Starts with 1 for the first failure.
exception - Terremark exception. This may contain information like HTTP error code, message etc.
relativePath - Relative URL path that was being accessed for the API call.
queryParams - Query arguments being passed to the API end point.
extraHeaders - Additional headers passed to the API end point.
responseClass - Type of response excepted from the API end point.
arguments - Additional arguments being passed to the end point.
Returns:
Implementation should return true to indicate that the call should be retried. If false is returned, the call is not retried and TerremarkException will be thrown.
